We should figure out how to make these the same file rather than copy/pasting.  (symlink? common include file?)
Added common include file: facebook-linux.inc.
Please make this a sub-layer of yosemite4 so that most of the code is common.  The only thing that should be different is the Nuvoton vs Aspeed parts.
Done.
Move this to a common machine.inc file.
Added common machine.inc: yosemite4-common.inc
Why is this flash size so much smaller than Yosemite4?
Used 131072 in yosemite4-common.inc.
Move this stuff to a common machine inc file so both platforms get the same thing.
Moved to yosemite4-common.inc
Need meta-yosemite4 too.
Done.
Please reformat this file in a sane way.  No tabs, lots of excess spaces in this file.
Done.
spaces, not tabs.
Done.

Is the config file really common?

We probably want a config for the peripheral chips (common) and one for the BMC chip (separate).

Maybe with u-boot the config is so small it doesn't matter?
Added common config: meta-facebook/recipes-bsp/uboot/files/yosemite4-common.cfg.
Please figure out how to share much of this with the existing yosemite4 kernel config.
Added meta-facebook/recipes-kernel/linux/files/yosemite4-common.cfg.

We can't add patches here.

We need to get meta-nuvoton using the 6.6 kernel also instead.
Removed.
Don't duplicate all of these files...
Shared with meta-yosemite4.
Thanks for adding this here!
Move these also?  Is there something that prevents these from working on Nuvoton currently?
Use expanded path rather than relative: `conf/machine/include/yosemite4-common.inc`

Seems like there is some work required here for consistency with the Aspeed platform.  We can follow up with that.

We do want to use the static no-rootfs file system layout though.  Might need some work to make that support Nuvoton.
Should we make a meta-yosemite4/meta-yosemite4-a to put the `*aspeed*.bbappend` files in so we don't need that BBIGNORE?
What does "BR57600" refer to?  Baud rate?

It really would be nice if Nuvoton included a reference version and a way to just patch the variables we want to change.  Having to include this giant XML file in every platform isn't great for maintenance, because I have no way of knowing what fields we've modified.
Can we remove tabs on this (use spaces)?
This probably came from a reference file, but can we remove these stray spaces?
We are missing an MACHINEOVERRIDES variable update if we had to make another version of this file.  We should be able to use the yosemite4 one.
